page.title: 08Houses, Alston Moor
page.content: Most of the{town houses}along Clitheroe, Bankfoot, Chapel Terrace and Fairhill View were built during the{19th century}and are separate houses joined together and were not designed as terraces. There are a few detatched and semi-detatched houses. The walls are made of{sandstone}but some have been painted with waterproofing material in white, cream or pale blue and some have been pebble-dashed. The roofs are{stone {tiles}and the houses are either two or three storeys high. The Jollybeard estate of{council houses}was built during the l960's. The walls are {brick and the roofs tiled.} They were built in stepped terraces because of the sloping ground. Potters Lane contains{modern bungalows}with tiled roofs and pebble-dashed walls, stone being used for decoration.
